#Text=Enjoy the Ice Festival in Harbin , China
#Text=The Ice and Snow Festival in Harbin , China is the 2nd largest ice and snow festival in the world .
#Text=People come from all over the world to participate and see the results of this snow and ice competition .
#Text=Here 's how to enjoy your trip to this northern Chinese city .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Choose the right timing :
#Text=The ice festival usually begins in early January .
#Text=( This may begin earlier depending on the weather that year ) .
#Text=It is best to go earlier in the season , because the larger structures will be closed off as the warm weather compromises their structure .
#Text=Be Prepared :
#Text=Harbin is the coldest city in China , located near the border with Russia .
#Text=Expect temperatures well below freezing , usually between 0 and 10 degree Fahrenheit .
#Text=Wear warm clothes !
#Text=Wear many layers and cold weather gear ( such as hats , scarves , gloves , etc. ) You will also need warm , waterproof , winter boots for the snow .
#Text=Know where to go :
#Text=The Ice and Snow Festival is not limited to one area .
#Text=There are several places you can go .
#Text=The largest , and by far the most popular , are the Ice and Snow World and the International Snow Sculpture Exhibition on Sun Island .
#Text=The Zhaolin Gardens are also popular .
#Text=Buy tickets :
#Text=The entrance tickets for the different Ice and Snow Festival areas are extremely expensive .
#Text=They usually cost upwards of 300 RMB .
#Text=If you have a student ID for an undergraduate degree at a Chinese university ( study period lasting approx. a year ) you can get half-price .
#Text=Children 's tickets are usually based on height not age .
#Text=Your child 's age may not guarantee a free ticket .
#Text=Elderly and Military ID 's can also result in a discount , but this may be only for Chinese people .
#Text=Cheaper tickets can be purchased online or through the Harbin Tourist Center on Zhongyang St. ( 中央大街 ) .
#Text=Know when to go :
#Text=Sun Island 's Snow Sculpture Exhibition closes before sunset .
#Text=The Ice and Snow World is open almost all day .
#Text=It is best to go just before sundown and stay while it 's dark .
#Text=This is where the famous 冰灯 are located .
#Text=Zhaolin Gardens is best viewed after sundown as well .
#Text=Find convenient transportation :
#Text=Ice and Snow World and the Snow Sculpture Exhibition are both located on Sun Island , which is farther from the city center ( and most likely even farther from your hotel ) .
#Text=There are bus lines that go to the exhibitions and Snow World on Sun Island .
#Text=These cost a measly 2 RMB and are direct lines .
#Text=Some hotels offer free shuttles .
#Text=You can hire a bus or a taxi .
#Text=Note that taxis do not use meters in Harbin .
#Text=You will have to agree on a price before you arrive .
#Text=For the adventurous , the river separating Sun Island and the main area of Harbin has a gondola which will take you to the other side .
#Text=From there , it 's just a short walk .
#Text=Follow these steps when you get there :
#Text=Bring a camera !
#Text=There are many beautiful hand-carved ice and snow sculptures you wo n't want to forget .
#Text=Try sledding !
#Text=Several places , particularly the Ice and Snow World , have several ice slides .
#Text=You do n't even need a sled !
#Text=The biggest ice slide is in Ice and Snow World .
#Text=They provide sleds and it 's free .
#Text=Take pictures with winter animals like snow foxes , or ride in a carriage pulled by horses , reindeer , or dogs .
#Text=Tips
#Text=There are very few places to eat in these places so it may be a good idea to eat beforehand .
#Text=Otherwise , there are candied fruits and other snacks available .
